HelpXML.Title: HUpsi
HelpXML.Purpose: HUpsi computes psi function (derivative of rho function) for Huber

Item.Name: u
Item.LongDesc: n x 1 vector containing residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample

Item.Name: c
Item.LongDesc: Scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator (beta in regression or mu in the location case ...)

Item.Name: psi
Item.TypeInd: Huber's psi associated to the residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample.

HelpXML.MoreAbout:
Function HUpsi transforms vector u as follows
\[ HUpsi(u)= \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} u & \mbox{if } |u/c| \leq 1 \\ c \times \mbox{sign}(u) & |u/c|>1 \\ \end{array} \right. \] See equation (2.38) p. 29 of Maronna et al. (2006)
Remark: Tukey's biweight psi-function is linear around u = 0 in accordance with Winsor's principle that all distributions are normal in the middle. This means that \psi (u)/u is constant over the linear region of \psi, so the points in that region tend to get equal weight.

References.Item: Maronna, R.A., Martin D. and Yohai V.J. (2006), Robust Statistics, Theory and Methods, Wiley, New York.
Riani M., Cerioli A., Torti F. (2014). On consistency factors and efficiency of robust S-estimators, TEST, Volume 23, Issue 2, pp 356-387. DOI: 10.1007/s11749-014-0357-7

Item.MATLABcode: close all x=-6:0.01:6; c=1.345; psiHU=HUpsi(x,c); plot(x,psiHU,'LineWidth',2) xlabel('$u$','Interpreter','Latex') ylabel('$\psi (u,1.345)$','Interpreter','Latex','FontSize',14) text(-c,-c,'-c=-1.345') text(c,c+0.1,'c=1.345') hold('on') stem(c,c,'LineStyle',':','LineWidth',2) stem(-c,-c,'LineStyle',':','LineWidth',2)
